Search: id:a048687

%I A048687
%S A048687 1,2,2,3,3,2,3,4,4,4,5,4,4,4,4,5,6,5,6,6,5,6,7,5,6,6,8,8,8,6,7,9,7,9,
%T A048687 9,8,8,9,10,8,10,8,9,11,8,9,10,9,10,10,10,9,11,10,12,11,12,11,13,11,
%U A048687 12,12,12,13,13,12,14,13,14,12,14,13,13,13,13,13,12,15,15,14,16,14,16,14
%N A048687 Number of classes generated by function A001221 when applied to binomial coefficients.
%F A048687 a(n) = Length[ Union[ Table[ A001221[ binomial[ n, k ] ], {k, 0, n} ] ] ]
%e A048687 For n=9 A001221({C(9,k)})={0,1,2,3,3,3,3,2,1,0} includes 4 distinct values so generating 4 classes of k values: {0,9},{1,8},{2,7} and {3,4,5,6}. So a(9)=4
%Y A048687 Cf. A001221, A007947.
%K A048687 nonn
%O A048687 1,2
%A A048687 _Labos Elemer_
